docs.lead_paragraph: Unauthorized immigrants who have stayed in the United States after being ordered deported have emerged as an easy target of the Trump administration’s aims.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than a dozen mushers departed Saturday amid a cacophony of barking dogs and cheering spectators for a 250-mile dash across the wilderness of northern Maine.

docs.lead_paragraph: A spokesman for ex-President Barack Obama on Saturday denied President Donald Trump's allegation that the former president ordered a wiretap of him last October.

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. Sen. Lindsey Graham told a rowdy town hall in South Carolina that health care is going to change in the United States. Just don't ask him for details.

docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey said on Saturday it would keep holding rallies in Germany and the Netherlands to urge Turks living there to back a vote to boost President Tayyip Erdogan's powers, despite opposition from authorities in both countries.

headline.print_headline: Turkey Plans More Pro-Erdogan Rallies, German Concerns Mount
headline.main: Turkey Plans More Pro-Erdogan Rallies, German Concerns Mount

docs.lead_paragraph: The New York governor will meet with political and business leaders in Jerusalem, with an itinerary that is heavy on symbolism and light on down time.

docs.lead_paragraph: French presidential candidate Francois Fillon, fighting for political survival, called on supporters Saturday not to "abdicate" to those trying to destroy him as the Socialist mayor of Paris asked him to cancel a scheduled rally that would test his staying power.

headline.print_headline: Paris Mayor Asks Struggling Candidate to Cancel His Rally

docs.lead_paragraph: Manchester United wasted the chance to move into the top five of the Premier League as their League Cup-winning hero Zlatan Ibrahimovic missed a penalty and 10-man Bournemouth battled to snatch an eventful 1-1 draw at Old Trafford on Saturday.

headline.print_headline: Manchester United Held as Zlatan Misfires, Leicester Win Again
headline.main: Manchester United Held as Zlatan Misfires, Leicester Win Again

docs.lead_paragraph: British anti-doping authorities condemned the leaking of information "which only serves to fuel rumor and innuendo" on Saturday after the latest media report surrounding athlete Mo Farah and his American coach Alberto Salazar.
